Application Description: "The National September 11 Memorial Museum at the World Trade Center bears solemn witness to the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001 and February 26, 1993. The Museum honors the 2,983 victims of these attacks and all those who risked their lives to save others. It further recognizes the thousands who survived and all who demonstrated extraordinary compassion in the aftermath.The 9/11 Memorial & Museum audio guide provides themed audio tours featuring stories from the day of 9/11 and the recovery at Ground Zero. It also presents details of the Museum’s archaeological elements and architectural designs of the Memorial and the Museum.Features- A comprehensive tour of the Museum narrated by Robert De Niro.- First person accounts of survival and resilience.- In-depth tours on new and rotating exhibitions and artifacts.- An age-appropriate tour for families and children.- An architectural tour of the site that explores the design of the original World Trade Center and the Museum as it stands today.- Translations in Chinese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese and Spanish.- Audio description and American Sign Language tours.Read moreCollapse.

Also some of the audio guides were under different names and locations than the narrators stated. However overall it was an excellent guide and very much enhanced our experience. Plus it was a good free alternative to the expensive audio and live tours for purchase at the museum. 100 audio clips are stored as 1 file rather that 100,so download was reset if I lost wi-fi connection or phone screen locked. No option to download text only. Took over 30 mins on 5th attempt, totally wasting my time in the museum. App needs better design to minimise these problems. The order of the audio does not match with the order of progress through the building, so you hear content that does not match up with where you are. Very confusing. Stopped using it after a couple of segments. Worked sporadically on a Nokia 6, but not on a Pixel 3. Think it might require cellular data to view, but even then was unreliable..
